message: I have a little experience with chargify on regular billing.  Was a breeze.
I've heard really good things about BrainTree (http://www.braintreepayments.com/) though and am looking to ditch Authorize.net in favor of them at some point.
Doing an integration now with Spreedly hosted pages, using Braintree as the payment gateway.
their customer support has been excellent and we've been very happy with their stability/pace of development
if you have any questions about cheddar getter or sharpy feel free to ping me, I'd be happy to help :)
I've done a couple integrations with cheddar getter and wrote a python client called sharpy (https://github.com/saaspire/sharpy).
My friend somewhat recently launched his recurring billing service, so here is a plug for him :) http://www.snapbill.com/
Thanks guys .  I'm checking things now. The client is non US so this adds to the complications

At voxy.com we use Recurly.com and I have nothing but positive comments about their service. We use Django and integrate via their API. The one downside (for us) is the lack  of multiple currency support. Other than that, they are +1 with many other features.
I would be interested in recurring billing services outside of the us, for a germany based client.
@frankbieniek @realchrisdev I believe snapbill supports multiple currencies, so maybe give it a look.
@frankbieniek We were ready to try http://www.adyen.com/ but we won't need it after all. Didn't actually try them but from my research they were our best bet for fire and forget billing in Europe.

We're going with Recurly ($69/mo) and Paypal Website Payments Pro for now ($30/mo and 2.9%), but as our volume goes up, we plan to switch to Braintree since their transaction fees are lower (2.29%), but monthly fees are higher ($55/mo)
